title: Please enter a number
body: Enter the number of the artpiece you would like to view. -V4

title: Art Piece 1
body: Super fancy wavy midnight inspired by my boyfriend's marvelous hair..

title: This is title text for entry 2
body: Due to my boyfriend's lovely piano planing, I had to create this piece with such vivid colors in an attempt to capture the picture he paints with the hammers of the piano.

title: This piece has the title: Art Piece No. 3
body: This is the body text for entry 3. It was inspired by my soon to be Fianc√©'s body. That is why it is so amazing.

title: Test 4
body: Let's go!

title: Humm .1?
body: Why? .1 is an intresting choice. Did you want just part of an art description?

title: -1 is an intresting choice
body: What made you think that a negative number would make any sense for an art peice? Speaking of things that don't make sense, what does adding a .0 to the end of the number do?

Aparently the .0 adds so much value they are not equal anymore. Weird. 
 Wait, so adding a zero to the end of the number changed something. I wonder what would happen if I...

title: -01.0 is a silly number
body: We are in silly mode now. What kind of number -01.0 and why is it different from -1.0 or -1? Do we even need the 1??

title: -0.0 is a little redundant
body: The negative sign doesn't change anything. The trailing zero doesn't do anything. However, why stop with two zeros when you could have 4?

title: -0.000 Really?!
body: You could have at least made symetrical.

title: -000.0 Really?!
body: You could have at least made symetrical.

title: -00.00 Very negative, very zero
body: I bet this is the firt time you have entered the number -00.00 into anything. This is one of those time where you ask yourself, "How did I get here?". Now that pesky negitive is really messing up the symmetry

title: 00.00 just very zero
body: This is very symmetrical and very satisfying. Speaking of satisfying, what do you think would be the most tasty number?

title: 3.14 Exactly, pi is yum
body: But this is not very much pi
MORE!
MORE!!
MORE!!!

title: 3.141593 now that is a probably enough pi
body: If we used this value to calculate the diamter of the earth we would only have error of about 40ft. Pretty crazy right? Speaking of the earth, how much does it accelerate things? Ask any real engineer. Remember imperial blood has been mostly destroyed!

title: 9.81 m/s^2 now this is a very nerdy number
body: You have made it to the end for now.
